channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yet again problem with pot holes. In Tyron Way there is a large pothole before the speed table by the post box. It is causing problems when you drive over it. Also there is a large pothole in The Vista and the one that was repaired in the main road opposite Tyron Way is now in need of repairing again., 6th February
item.description:
The potholes have been here for some time and are only getting worse. They are just filled with tarmac and hit with a shovel. Not very effective or long lasting with the amount of traffic that uses the road on a regular basis.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Tyron Way, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: O/s 221 Kilburn High Road NW6 7JG, 6th February
item.description:
Pothole on road on pedestrian crossing o/s Kilburn Mall. Brent side but maintained by Camden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218, Kilburn High Road, Kilburn, Greater London

item.title: Request for Cleaning of Common Areas, 6th February
item.description:
Contractors working in Shere House, flats 24–31, did not clean the common areas after completing their work. The shared spaces were left dirty and untidy and require cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrick Square, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two foot long pothole, 6th February
item.description:
Debris from the various pothole has scattered around and seems to have caused the road surface to bad. Fear of damaged tyres and tracking concerns for all vehicles coming and going. This also includes damage to properties from stone chips.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorothy Evans Close, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken chair still there!, 6th February
item.description:
I received an email to say this had been cleared but it is still there. It’s on the walkway at the back of the underground car park right where the pin is dropped. Maybe the other chairs that were abandoned by the bin store cleared, but this one still here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunstor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeat dog fouling on Bromar Road, 6th February
item.description:
There is regularly a large amount of dog faeces on Bromar Road since I moved here in March 2025. I have a toddler who can walk in it which is extremely dangerous and unhygienic. Please can you clear the faeces and install signs and other warnings as there are clearly multiple dog owners allowing this to happen regularly. Please contact me to let me know what action will be taken. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Bromar Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Camberwell Green SE5, along southern perimeter. Tags on cabinets, smart bin and litterbin., 6th February
item.description:
Please remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: A forest bike has been left for at least a week on the corner of Brackley Road and Lawn Road in Beckenham, 6th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Brackley Road, New Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Dog poo, 6th February
item.description:
I was contacted today to say the dog poo has been cleared, but it has not! The Newington Green end of Church Walk in front of the artwork on wall there is lots of dog poo. Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: At least 7 x pot holes., 6th February
item.description:
From near the end of the flats in St. Mary's Street to the T junction with Kingsman Street there are SEVEN potholes.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Mary Street, Woolwich

item.title: Over grown hedge blocking path near school, 6th February
item.description:
Very busy area near school and post office has a hedge that protrudes so much people have to walk on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caroline Close, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars constantly using pavements to drive on to park outside their house ruining grass verges and grass space, 6th February
item.description:
Vehicles are constantly using the green space on Whitebeam Avenue to park on, this ruins our green space space. Vehicles use the pavement to drive up to the green space and our grass verges are ruined, creating muddy puddles and killing the grass. There needs to be something in place to stop this as it’s getting ridiculous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caroline Close, Streatham Hill, Greater London

item.title: Parking on top of pavement ruining grass verge - impossible to use when walking, 6th February
item.description:
Cars and vans park and drive on top of the grass verge where Lovelace Avenue and Whitebeam Avenue meet. Children have to walk all the way round to cross the road and it is ruining any chance of any grass being able to grow on that corner. When will posts or other deterrents be installed? It’s an ongoing problem that isn’t being addressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
